definitions.def: Unit for measuring angles, with 2π radians equaling 360˚.

secText: The radian measure of a 360° angle, a complete revolution of a circle, is 2π.
To convert degrees to radians, multiply by π radians180°. This fraction is a simplified version of 2π divided by 360°.
To convert radians to degrees, multiply by <math><mrow><mfrac linethickness="thin"><mrow><mn>180</mn><mo>°</mo></mrow><mi>π</mi></mfrac></mrow></math>.
As an example, we show in the second diagram how to convert 30° to radians. To do so, we multiply by the conversion factor, π radians divided by 180°. The result is π6 radians.
We do a similar operation on two other common angles, showing the radian equivalents of 45° and 60°. These angles are simple fractions involving π. Radians can also be abbreviated as “rad.”
